result.execSummary:
The defendant William Jesse Williams II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to continue to pay attorney fees.  Pymt plan of $50 per month to begin 6/1/16, due 1st of each month.  Payments to apply to attorney fees first, then fine and costs.
** JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $4,541.81.

75 days jail imposed with huber or work release privileges, defendant must participate and comply with OWI program; 1st 48 hrs w/o release. To exercise EMP, defendant must be in compliance with OWI program and negotiated plea.  An additional 20 days jail imposed and stayed if defendant complies with the OWI program.

Defendant appears in person without an attorney.  Defendant asks about a court appointed attorney.  Court modifies bond to $1,500 Signature Bond with the same conditions as the previous bond.
Adjourned Initial Appearance- July 6, 2015 @ 9:00 a.m.
Adjourned initial appearance at 07-06-2015 09:00 am

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
May not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription in own name and take as prescribed by a licensed provider.
Take all prescription as prescribed.
May not possess drug paraphernalia.
May not be present where controlled substances are illegally sold or consumed.
May not have contact with known drug dealers or drug users or their residences.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON SIGNING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am, except for work purposes or treatment purposes, as approved by the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant may only be released Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm, so defendant can sign up for the Bond Monitoring Program.
